response:
Downbeat nystagmus, right-sided limb ataxia (intention tremor, dysdiadochokinesia), spastic paraparesis more marked in the right leg with brisk reflexes and extensor plantar, impaired vibration/joint-position sense in both legs, positive Romberg, and unsteady gait are best explained by a single lesion at the right cervicomedullary junction compressing cerebellar connections, corticospinal tracts, and dorsal columns.

lesion_locations = ["right cervicomedullary junction"]
